_meanings:
{@--1@} A forest, wood
thicket of trees; {#eko vAsaH pattane vA#},
{#vane vA#} <ls>Bh. 3. 120</ls>; {#vane'pi dozAH#} 
{#praBavaMti rAgiRAm#}.

{@--2@} A cluster, group, a
quantity of lotuses or other plants
growing in a thick bed; {#citradvipAH#}
{#padmavanAvatIrRAH#} <ls>R. 16. 16</ls>, <ls n="R.">6. 86.</ls>

{@--3@}
A place of abode, residence, house.

{@--8@}
Dwelling in a forest, living abroad.

{@--11@} Worshipping. (As the
first member of <ab>comp.</ab> {#vana#} may be
translated by ‘wild’, ‘forest’;  
{#vanavarAhaH, vanakadalI, vanapuzpaM#} &c.).

abode in the woods, the
third stage in the religious life of a
Brāhmaṇa.

{2} a sort of
crow or raven.

{1} an inhabitant of a wood, 

a forester.

{3} a wild animal such as a
monkey, boar &c.

a thicket,
the thick part of a forest.

surrounding a forest and stopping
all egress; <ls>Ś. 2.</ls>

living in a forest, haunting
woods, sylvan.

{3} the fabulous 
eightlegged animal called Śarabha.

roaming about or residence in a
forest.

a
sylvan deity, a dryad; <ls>R. 2. 12</ls>,
<ls n="R.">9. 52</ls>; <ls>Ś. 4. 4</ls>; <ls>Ku. 3. 52</ls>, <ls n="Ku.">6. 39.</ls>

a tree growing wild in a 
forest.

the
female of the wild ox or {%Bos gavœus%}.

the neighbourhood of a wood, the
forest region itself.

retiring 
into a wood, leading the life of a
hermit.

a wood situated on a
table-land.

adorned with a chaplet
of wood-flowers.

{1} a grove or
long row of trees.

{1}
an ornament or beauty of the wood.

{1} a forest-dweller, forester.
{2} a hermit; so {#vanasTAyin#}.

a solemn 
procession into a forest for the 
purpose of cutting wood for an idol.
